storyInfo: Venezia Junior finds out about the city hall and court's actions, forces Venezia Senior to 'retire', and decides to take over the city during Carnevale. Eirene finds out that the Truckers' Union has never escaped the famiglia's shadow, and decides to organize the drivers to separate themselves from the mob.

attributes.content: <p=2>November 8th, 1100    6:15 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: You sent for me, Don Venezia?
attributes.name: Terrified Mafioso

attributes.content: Anton has a question for you.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Over here, Carle.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Antonio...
attributes.name: Terrified Mafioso

attributes.content: Any cars headed towards Sicilia recently?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Passenger routes are operating as usual. Though, most people are coming in here, and not out.
attributes.name: Terrified Mafioso

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Go pack up your belongings. You should be able to make the last ride over.
attributes.name: Antonio
Terrified Mafioso
attributes.content: Gotcha—

attributes.name: Terrified Mafioso
attributes.content: Uh, Huh? Antonio, what's the meaning of this?
Don't you have a fratello in Sicilia? You can't stay in Nuova Volsinii any longer, and can't go back to Montelupe either, so you should go to him.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Your negligence has caused us to lose a whole carload of 'tires'.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I gave you a chance. Just greet the don at the port, couldn't even manage that. That old Saluzzo stronzo even got to meet papa before you did.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Carle, I've already given you the most decent ending possible by letting you leave, alive. Take this—
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: A check from a bank, with a huge sum written on it.
The famiglia associate takes it, stunned. He sees his own name written on the upper left, already crossed out by Antonio himself.
Call it a settlement fee. Without the famiglia's protection, you'll need a lot of money.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I've been with the Venezias for more than a decade. I was following the Don before you even came in here, can't you just, for his sake—
attributes.name: Terrified Mafioso

attributes.content: D-Don Venezia—!
attributes.name: Terrified Mafioso

attributes.content: Employees who make mistakes must naturally be punished, yes?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Of course. You're the head of Venezia Trucking. You call the shots.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Anton... you didn't inform me about this in advance.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Please don't blame me for this.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The police were just here earlier. They wanted to inspect the vehicle factories and service stations under the Venezia name. They said it was just a routine inspection before Carnevale, but the official warrant said it was an impromptu check.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I also just received news that Alberto was suddenly temporarily detained for corporate qualification issues.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I have no doubt the trial this morning has upset our dear judge Lavinia. She's hoping to control a situation she knows nothing of this way.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The situation spiraled out of my control, so I had to deal with Carle like that. It'll be hard to convince the masses otherwise.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: This year, Venezia Trucking has carefully complied with the New Urban Management Act, and the only clue we had proving otherwise was burned to cinders yesterday at the port.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The only person who can affect our business has been dealt with.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: But when Carnevale is over and Lavinia has her hands free, I'm afraid she'll try her best to target us.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: How do you plan on handling it?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: My original idea was to slowly transform this city—Let it have a set of laws absent in other cities, while establishing an underground order the Siracusans are accustomed to.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Venezia Trucking's business has been smooth sailing. The trick is to follow these two tenets: Comply with the New Urban Management Act, but also not.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Of course, the other famiglie are doing the same, but adapting to the rules of the new game is quite difficult.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The Venezias can fit perfectly into both sets of laws, and we've been excelling at it.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: So much so that today we can discard one and switch to the other immediately.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: So you want to completely control this city?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: You've lost yourself, Anton. Don't forget Nuova Volsinii has Signora Sicilia's endorsement. She supports the youths' reforms.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: You're openly defying her authority and turning us against all of Siracusa this way. You're using the entire Famiglia Venezia as your betting chip!
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: It sounds like that, yes.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The last one to do that was Bernardo... he only died last year!
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Are you afraid of Signora Sicilia, afraid of the youngsters at City Hall yelling their ideals across the room?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You've really gotten old, papa.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: We Venezias hold a most unusual seat in the Grey Hall, a 'hybrid' famiglia. Lupos with no blood ties who left their previous pack, Vulpos like Ingrid, and Perros like you...
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: The other famiglie don't think too kindly of us, but we stand here today nonetheless. Our presence here embodies every Venezia's sweat and blood.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Our ties run closer than bloodlines, and I want everyone in the famiglia to have a decent end.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: But you, you want to put us in great danger... Anton, I think you've forgotten my teachings.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Papa, have I ever mentioned how a Perro like me ended up in Siracusa?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I was a soldier, serving the True Bolívarians.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I have but a superficial understanding of the situation in Bolívar...
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: It actually doesn't matter which flag you fight under in Bolívar. You don't have to understand why the three parties are fighting one another. I mean, everyone's just trying to survive by giving it their all.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I was in a guerrilla force raiding a village under the Singas dynasty, but we were discovered, and the entire squad became captives.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The twenty of us emptied every pocket and piled our possessions together to bribe the executioner to spare us, change our status from 'death penalty' to 'hard labor'.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The officer responsible for driving us was a paunchy aristocrat. He was drunk that day, made a mistake during the review process, and only came to us with a truck... big enough to sit just ten people.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The executioner asked him what to do next. Can you guess how that stronzo replied?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: He belched from his drink as he whipped out a pen and drew a circle on our list, saying: There's clearly only ten people on the list, right?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: We killed him, cut off his head, escaped Bolívar, and what happened next, I'm sure you know.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Anton, this is the first time I've heard of—
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Haha. It's been too long I almost forgot about it.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Do you know why it suddenly came back to me?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I was discussing with our young and promising mayor about building a logistical network in the city. He refused me, and then shared how the city came about, and its mission...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: A so-called 'experimental ground', with a new order governing people from the old, vastly different from the Siracusan tradition...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: He knew people would have trouble adapting, irreconcilable conflicts would occur, and the system might even swallow groups of people in the process... but it couldn't be helped, there was a potential future.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: And all of that happened because four young people sat at the Grey Hall's round table and lobbied for their idea so passionately...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Signora Sicilia allocated them one of Siracusa's twenty-three cities, without hesitation...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: A move so cavalier, like that aristocrat who circled half our names away.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Papa, Leontuzzo was indeed quite sincere and inspiring at the time, but I almost lost control, I wanted to burst into laughter... That boy knows nothing at all.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You said I lost myself?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: No, not at all. What I want to do has always been the same.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I hate that aristocrat and Signora Sicilia. I hate their power to wantonly draw their circles as they please. I want to take it all away from them!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Anton...
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Phew—Alright, Papa. I've said a bit too much today. I'm not here to let you lecture me on decency or dignity, nor am I here to analyze what's going on in Siracusa.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: My activities this year alone are not enough to land a seat at the gambling table...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Papa, don't we have a landship en-route nearby? I'd like the rights to make an emergency dispatch.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: This is something only Don Venezia can do.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: If I refuse, will the men guarding the door deal with me like how you handled Carle?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Of course not, you're a truly decent man worthy of a dignified end.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You're old, Papa. Haven't you always suggested you retire?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Scusi, is Eirene not here right now?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: ...Y-Your Honor?
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: U-Uh, Eirene's not here. Everyone went to celebrate her acquittal, that's why.
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: So why aren't you with them?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I-I'm just servicing these trucks. See?
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: Carnevale's tomorrow, and they'll need a lot of our cars...
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: Someone has to do it.
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: You're lying, Signore.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: When you see her, please let Eirene know I need to meet her, even outside of office hours.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: ...Got it.
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: Eirene, here. The schedule table for this year.
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: As you said, I marked all the Venezia Trucking related records. Trip times, loading instructions, driver names... they're all in there.
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: Yep, matches with Sommer's notebook.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Sommer wanted to bring Guri here; Carmelo was secretly nursing his injuries with alcohol and couldn't get it from us; Gianni and Ruggiero had their own troubles too...
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Every member of ours they targeted was carefully selected.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: There aren't many records, but the shipment frequency is very consistent. That night wasn't the first time they smuggled weapons into the city for sure...
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: You were right. That judge did come looking for you at the camp. After she left, some famiglie associates were tailing her in secret.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: I drove behind her car and came back here only after I saw her enter the courthouse.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: There's also one more thing.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: I happened to see Saluzzo Vino's legal team hurrying into the courthouse.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: I asked around, and apparently not long ago the police suddenly showed up at one of the Saluzzo wineries and took Alberto away.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Venezia Trucking also got the cops at their door at the same time. The police and judges should be inspecting their factories right now.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Lavinia probably doesn't know about the weapons yet, but the car accident and port fire has already sent out a dangerous signal...
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Leontuzzo's injured and still hospitalized even now. As Nuova Volsinii's Supreme Justice, she tries her best to get the situation under control.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: She didn't use a direct method with us like she did with the other two... she went to camp to warn us.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: In other words, an ultimatum.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Wait, about what Lyudmila just said...
attributes.name: Truck Driver

attributes.content: Neither Alberto or Venezia Junior will willingly meet their demise.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Lavinia's in danger right now.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Those wise guys only followed her with no intentions to harm her.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: We're in Nuova Volsinii after all, we got cops patrolling the streets. Besides, they have an even better time slot available...
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: You mean Carnevale...?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: We could let the judge know.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Eirene stays still for a long time before shaking her head.
Are you still hesitant to let her know about the Truckers' Union? But can you really just stand here and watch something happen to her?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: She's not a bad person at least.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: You got it wrong, Lyudmila.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: It's too late for us now to stay out of it.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: If the famiglie dare make a direct attempt on Lavinia's life during Carnevale, there's no chance they'll let the Truckers' Union go. If that happens, we can only wait for the slaughter to happen.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: I'm just thinking what I should do. I don't want something like what happened with Sommer to happen again...
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Giving Lavinia a direct warning isn't the best choice here.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Lyudmila, did you see the weapons? How many were there?
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Based on the amount I saw and total number of shifts on the schedule—
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: I estimate there's enough Venezia weapons in the city to arm several tactical squads with dozens of people in each.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: We have more than two hundred registered members, but if we include ad-hoc staff and contract workers, we'll have several times the number of people.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: I just realized the Truckers' Union is actually the largest organization in Nuova Volsinii.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Maybe we can manage it. Protecting a single person in the dark.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: Do you really just want to protect that judge?
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Sommer taught me one thing at least: no one can be trusted in this city but ourselves.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: So we can only protect ourselves... even if that means resorting to violence.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: When I was in Ursus, I knew someone with similar ideas. She lost herself in the end.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: You want to stop me?
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: No... What happened with Sommer needs a proper ending.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: But of course, he wouldn't want to see you lose yourself either.
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: Eirene, I guarantee you won't cross that final line...
attributes.name: Lyudmila

attributes.content: I promise you I won't, Lyudmila.
attributes.name: Eirene

attributes.content: I'm perfectly aware what I'm doing.
attributes.name: Eirene
